questions.question: What does a red traffic light signal mean?
questions.explanation: A red light indicates drivers must stop before the intersection.

questions.question: What does a yellow diamond-shaped sign indicate?
questions.explanation: Yellow diamond-shaped signs are used to warn drivers of potential hazards ahead.

questions.question: What does a 'No U-Turn' sign mean?
questions.explanation: A 'No U-Turn' sign means U-turns are prohibited.

questions.question: At an intersection, who has the right of way when both drivers arrive at the same time?
questions.explanation: When two vehicles arrive at an intersection at the same time, the driver on the right has the right of way.

questions.question: What is the speed limit in residential areas unless otherwise posted in Rhode Island?
questions.explanation: The default speed limit in residential areas in Rhode Island is 25 mph unless otherwise posted.

questions.question: When parallel parking, how far should your vehicle be from the curb?
questions.explanation: When parallel parking, your vehicle should be no more than 12 inches away from the curb.

questions.question: What should you do if your vehicle starts to skid on a wet road?
options: Steer in the direction of the skid
Steer in the opposite direction of the skid
questions.correctAnswer: Steer in the direction of the skid
questions.explanation: If your vehicle skids, you should steer in the direction of the skid to regain control.

questions.question: What does a green arrow signal indicate?
options: Go in the direction of the arrow
Do not go in the direction of the arrow
questions.correctAnswer: Go in the direction of the arrow
questions.explanation: A green arrow signal means you can proceed in the direction of the arrow if the way is clear.

questions.question: What should you do when you see a 'Yield' sign?
options: Slow down and prepare to stop if necessary
questions.correctAnswer: Slow down and prepare to stop if necessary
questions.explanation: A 'Yield' sign means you should slow down and let vehicles crossing your path go first.

questions.question: What is the maximum speed limit on interstate highways in Rhode Island unless otherwise posted?
questions.explanation: The maximum speed limit on interstate highways in Rhode Island is 65 mph unless otherwise posted.
